Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Virtual Network, including IP address ranges, subnet configurations, and connectivity needs. Identify applications and services that will use the VNet.
Design the architecture of the Virtual Network, including subnets, address spaces, and integration with on-premises networks or other VNets.
Secure approvals for the VNet design and address space allocation from relevant stakeholders.
Provision the Virtual Network in the Azure portal, specifying the address space and subnets as per the design.
Set up subnets within the Virtual Network, ensuring proper segmentation and alignment with the design requirements.
Apply security controls such as Network Security Groups (NSGs) and Azure Firewall to protect the Virtual Network and its subnets.
Deploy and configure a VPN Gateway if hybrid connectivity with on-premises networks is required.
Set up VNet peering to connect the Virtual Network with other VNets in the same or different regions.
Perform connectivity tests to ensure the Virtual Network is functioning as expected, including subnet communication and external connectivity.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the Virtual Network using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to track performance and detect issues.
Create detailed documentation of the Virtual Network setup, including address spaces, subnets, security measures, and connectivity configurations.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Virtual Network.
Conduct periodic audits to ensure the Virtual Network complies with security and operational standards.
Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and status of the Virtual Network. Identify and investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Regularly review and update NSGs to ensure proper access control and security measures are in place for the Virtual Network.
Conduct audits of Virtual Network configurations to ensure alignment with documented architecture and best practices for the service.
Review and update routing tables to ensure proper traffic flow and connectivity within the Virtual Network.
Regularly back up configurations of Virtual Network settings, including subnets, NSGs, and routing tables. Ensure secure and accessible storage of backups for potential restoration.
Perform failover tests to verify that redundant paths, including VPN backups, function correctly and can take over in case of primary path failures.
Analyze Virtual Network performance data to ensure operations within expected parameters. Investigate and address any performance deviations.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Virtual Network outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the Virtual Network connectivity provider. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for Virtual Network upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Virtual Network performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
